title: “How far do you reach?” In the present tense, is this correct? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi! Your sentence, ‘How far do you reach?’ is grammatically correct if you are talking about a routine habit. If that is not the case, then, it is incorrect as you have placed a ‘question mark’ in the end. Also, ‘How far do you reach’ sounds futuristic and suggests that the speaker is looking forward to something (as in ‘how far do you reach will be revealed only after the race is over’). If you intend to ask someone how far they go- say for a walk, or something in similar context, then, the correct formation would be- “How far do you go?”. You may also consider rephrasing it according to the context as follows: How long does it take to reach? (Simple Present using the auxiliary verb ‘do’)How far have you reached? (Present Perfect Tense)How far did you reach? (Past Tense)I hope it will help you!
No ,it's incorrect… The correct statement will be,”How far did you reach?”
